int.label: Notification Received and Displayed by the OS.
Content Notification Top of Feed Promo is enabled.
Content Notification Set Up List Promo is enabled.

Content Notification Set Up List Promo is registered.
Notification confirmation snackbar action button tapped
Main button tapped, to show OS prompt
Promo was shown to the user
Clicked one of the list items

enum.name: FeedActivityBucket
enum.int: The user has no activity in the last 28 days.
The user has 1-7 days of activity in the last 28 days.
The user has 8-15 days of activity in the last 28 days.
The user has 16+ days of activity in the last 28 days.

int.label: Clicked on the feed menu button

enum.name: FeedEngagementType
enum.int: Visit - user scrolled an inch or interacted
Visit - user scrolled any amount or interacted"
Interaction - Opening a page or using the menu"
Interaction - Scrolled any amount
Visit - user (a) had a good explicit interaction, (b) spent a minute in the feed and scrolled, or (c) spent ten seconds viewing or opening a piece of content.

int.label: Failed - network response has no body
Failed - error translating to internal protos
Failed - data in store is stale
Failed - data in store has timestamp from the future
Failed - loading from network is suppressed due to recent history deletion
Failed - cannot load from network while offline
Failed - cannot parse network response body
Failed - cannot load more content because the model is not yet loaded
Failed - feed is disabled by enterprise policy
Failed - network fetch failed or returned a non-200 status
Failed - cannot load more, no next page token
Failed - data in store is stale, last refresh missed
Success loading stale data, after network failure
Failed - data in store is expired
Failed - data in store is for another user
Failed - cannot load stream with pending clear all
Failed - already has unread content available
Failed - user does not follow any web feeds
Failed - account token fetch failed because it was for the wrong account
Failed - account token fetch timed out

enum.name: FeedRefreshTrigger
enum.int: The feed is visible and trigger is not already one of the other foreground visible triggers.
A server request is only made if the feed model is considered stale.
The feed is not visible but the app is in the foreground (e.g., user is in another tab).
A new feed view controller has been configured and has become visible to the user.
The app is backgrounding from the foreground and the refresh is running on an app extended execution time.
Refresh is triggered in a background cold start with app close enabled.
Refresh is triggered in a background warm start with app close enabled.

Showing a sign-in only flow triggered from feed.
Showing a sign-in disabled snackbar triggered from feed.

The service disable message was shown when the user tapped on the Feed sync promo.

Failed to remove uploaded actions from store
Ran out of actions upload quota
Pending action was stored for later upload
Successfully uploaded some actions and stored a new consistency token
Updated and tried to upload all pending actions and finished without receiving a new consistency token
Upload attempt was aborted because the account is now signed-out
Could not upload because does not meet conditions
Can not upload actions for another user
Could not upload because pending clear all

enum.name: WebFeedChangeReason
enum.int: Unknown change reason

enum.name: WebFeedPageInformationRequestReason
enum.int: The user requested to Follow the current web page.
A Follow recommendation is being considered the current web page.

int.label: Available - Post-follow dialog for an available web feed
Unavailable - Post-follow dialog for an unavailable web feed
Failed because the device is offline
Failed due to pending ClearAll action
Failed due to a network error
Failed because the request was throttled client-side
Failed because there is a pending ClearAll operation
Success. The follow/unfollow succeeded. Also reported when following an already-followed web feed, or unfollowing a web feed which is not followed.
Failed because the device is offline
